title: Just get error message when I aska question
review: I just get the following error message when I ask a question: {"cf_details". "This request is invalid."}

title: only one problem
review: I rate this 4 stars because for one little thing. When I’m chatting with ChatGPT, the app increases the volume of my keyboard so when I type on the app, the keyboard is really really loud. So fix that please developers.

title: How great the app is! But when it can adapt for iPad?
review: Thanks for your teamwork to make ChatGPT for iOS be realized, how wonderful it performs in my iPhone ,but it doesn’t work as well in iPad ,could you please adapt this app for iPadOS recently?

title: It’s ok
review: It’s more convenient than going to the website, that’s for sure, but my response history doesn’t stay on the screen when I reopen the app after closing it, and for some reason you can’t copy any of the response to paste into another application, which is extremely dumb.

title: Needs true iPad form version
review:
Is it really that hard to make an iPhone form version AND an iPad form version?

It’s really annoying when developers waste all the space available to them by just slapping an iPhone version of their apps with an iPad label.

title: Limited knowledge!
review:
When I ask about recent datas it says:

My knowledge base was trained on a vast dataset until the year 2021!!!!

This allows me to provide general information on various topics, but I am not equipped with knowledge about current events, recent discoveries, or developments!!!!
My purpose is to assist users with general inquiries and provide helpful responses. 

If you need detailed or up-to-date information on a current topic, I recommend seeking information from reliable and up-to-date sources!!!!!!
 
Why it hasn’t been updated?! Weird!

title: Web is better
review: The app seems to lock up.  The web page is substantially better.  If you want an icon for it, or any web page, bring up the page in Safari, click the middle button at the bottom, scroll down and pick “Add to Home Screen”

title: Still quite broken on iPhone Minis
review: Also no way to use plugins it seems, but I really like the haptic feedback and everything I mentioned in the previous review (which seems to be deleted now with the update, unfortunately).

title: Improving
review: After a tough start with the app. The app's constantly evolving. I like the convenience of using the app. I hope they integrate a keyboard feature or include chat gpt in the open or share app section of the phone!

title: Screen getting very hot
review: My phones gets very hot when using this app. It seems like it’s using too many resources. Needs to be patched. Otherwise is a nice interface to ChatGPT.

title: Can we get an iPad display?
review: Absolutely love the app, but on my iPad Pro the app stays in a phone sized screen. This makes it very hard to type on the app, and an iPad interface would be amazing. Otherwise 10/10

title: Good

title: Amazing app! Do NOT hesitate!
review: Earlier, I gave a five star review for similar app, but this is even better! I can’t believe it. I haven’t given app reviews in years, but I had to come here and do this. It’s like Siri but much, much better. I hit my hourly limit on the free app so I thought I’d stop and write this review. There’s a very good chance I’m going to pay for this app, which is some thing I have not done in many years.

title: Phone gets HOT
review: After only 1 minute of chatting, my phone gets HOT fast!! Great app otherwise, but they need to fix this, or else I’m better off using the website (no phone heat, and thus better battery life too). Fix plz

title: Hoooooot

review: This app manages to harness most of the capabilities of the website, excluding the beta features. The voice input feature is cool. I’m hoping to have access to browsing and plugins soon!

review: With the flood of ad-plagued AI chatbots from greedy developers on the App Store, all of which are presumably just running ChatGPT under the hood, it’s great to finally have an official mobile client.

 I and sure open AI will address this bug in future versions. I do not recommend the app if you’re using it for detailed work.

title: Cuts out the middleman
review:
Chat GPT is like using google but instead of spending a lot of time researching your answers, it just spits out exactly what you’re asking.

Chat GPT is an AI tool that is really only limited to your imagination.

title: July 4th on Monday?

Following is the answer to my q: Will there be a long weekend for 7/4?

A: The 4th of July falls on a Monday this year, so it will likely create a long weekend for many people. This can vary depending on your specific work or school schedule, so it’s best to confirm with your employer or educational institution to determine if you’ll have a long weekend for the 4th of July holiday.

title: Formula text needs fixing
review:
The app is wonderful but the failure to format text properly like on the desktop is a major problem for trying to do things like math. A fix would warrant 5 stars.

Example of what I mean (this is what chatgpt says when I request exponent rules):
	•	(x^{-1}) is the same as (\frac{1}{x}).
	•	(x^{-2}) is the same as (\frac{1}{x^2}).
	•	(x^{-3}) is the same as (\frac{1}{x^3}).

title: positive feedback and ideas
review:
while im still brainstorming more ideas i thought these two would be worth mentioning for now I- "heart" or "star" just a way to save key items or specific texts without having to copy the whole thing and pasting it into a different "notes" app II- (i don't have a title for this one) but making so "luna" how i named "chat gpt" (i thought the A.I needed a more humane name and what better name to represent humanity if not luna!) could retain information on previous history and different chat's, i don't know what the dimensions of these would be or if it's even a good idea but i thought of it anyways very cool, i'm enjoying our conversations and perhaps considering using luna (chat gpt🙄) even before recurring to google III- implementing new and "better" search engines for example a whole chat dedicated to only explaining concepts to a six year old without you having to type "define certain thing to a six year old" IV- when explaining concept's to a six year old be more specific on the "toy" rather than just saying "toy" for every example given or using another analogy but i know it is hard giving that a six year old *usually* doesn't know many examples they would relate to and actually understand outside of the bubble of "toys" V- a section of the app dedicated to taking notes or reviewing one's texts and essays VI- enabling camera so luna can catalog (and or) make an inventory of items and even fauna, flora and rocks 

VII- making her capable of dictation so she can break down difficult texts enabling you to listen to it while multitasking

title: Dear OpenAI Team,
review: I hope this message finds you well. I would like to express my gratitude for developing the OpenAI iOS application. It has undoubtedly made a significant impact on my productivity and has become an essential tool in my daily routine. I appreciate the hard work and dedication your team has put into creating such a powerful and innovative application. While the OpenAI iOS application is already impressive, I would like to provide some constructive feedback to further enhance its usability and user experience. These suggestions aim to refine the application and make it even more valuable for users like myself: Improved Performance and Responsiveness: Occasionally, I have noticed minor delays or lag when interacting with the application. Enhancing its performance and responsiveness would greatly improve the overall user experience. Enhanced Offline Capabilities: The ability to use the OpenAI iOS application offline would be highly beneficial, especially in situations where an internet connection is not available. Expanding offline capabilities would make the application more reliable and versatile. Voice Input and Output: Introducing voice input and output features would be a game-changer for users who prefer hands-free interaction with the application. This addition would provide convenience and accessibility, particularly in situations where typing is not feasible. Customizable Interface: Offering customization options for the application's interface would allow users to personalize their experience. Features like theme selection, font sizes, and layout customization would greatly enhance user satisfaction and cater to individual preferences. Advanced Collaboration Features: As someone who frequently collaborates on projects, having the ability to easily share and collaborate within the OpenAI iOS application would be incredibly valuable. Features such as real-time collaboration, shared document editing, and version control would enhance teamwork and productivity. Comprehensive Documentation and Tutorials: Providing comprehensive documentation, tutorials, and examples within the application would greatly assist users in understanding and utilizing its full potential. Clear and concise explanations, along with practical use cases, would empower users to make the most out of the application's capabilities. Enhanced Privacy and Data Security: Given the sensitivity of the information shared and processed within the application, reinforcing privacy measures and data security would instill further trust in your user base. Transparent privacy policies, data encryption, and user-controlled data management options would contribute to a more secure and trustworthy environment. I hope you find these suggestions helpful in further improving the OpenAI iOS application. Once again, thank you for your hard work in developing such a remarkable tool. I look forward to seeing how the application evolves and continues to empower users like myself.

title: Amazing….
review:
To be honest, I have been blown away by this AI interface. Ask it anything within reason and it answers you almost immediately. I have asked it questions on everything from physics to the etymology of profanity and it answers every time. The only flaws I have found are these:
1. As long as you stay on the same chat, it will remember things you’ve already talked about and you can build on that conversation. Sometimes tho, when you exit the app then come back to it sometime later, it will have erased the discussion you were having and it will start all over. 
2. It gives FAR too many disclaimers and admonishments with its answers. For example, when asking it about specific, profane words and their meaning, it will always say something like “ it’s important to remember that this is a vulgar, offensive word and should not be used in most settings”. I tell it thank you and ask it not to repeat the disclaimers/admonishments again. It agrees not to and I’ll ask it the exact same question and it INSISTS on including the disclaimer/admonishment in every reply. That is frustrating!
3. Sometimes, the AI will give you incorrect information. I realize that this is stated in the user agreement but I think it bears fleshing out a little bit. For example, when discussing firearms ballistics, asking the AI to arrange certain calibers in order of their Max effective range from shortest to longest, sometimes it will give correct info. Then asking it the exact same question later on, it will move the order of 2-4 of those calibers. When you call it on its mistake and ask it which is correct, it will say”My apologies. You are correct. Here is the correct order”. 
There are other minor things but those are the biggest 3 for me. Still, it’s light years ahead of SIRI, Hey Google or Alexa.

title: Please read!
review:
This app has worked wonders. As a girl still in her wacky ways, decided to call
My besties and we talked about this app for long periods of time, making jokes of what to right about. And then we did it. We wrote stories of broccoli owls and their leader Ollie trying to find a broccoli farm and learned about friendship, a tree named arborix and the tree decapitating itself while the brain (Arbore) longed to be free and learned a very important lesson about self love, and three British cats named trixie, Enzo, and karma, who all loved sipping tea and listening to jazz music. And somehow it took less than a minute for all of these to generate! To put it up even more to the test, we asked it to combine the stories and it turned out beautifully! I definintly will be using this app way more in the future and I think this is the greatest thing to exist. Like seriously, I even asked it to right an inspiring story about America from a twelve year old nerdy boys prospective and it only took a minute to generate and took about ten minutes to read! The story was great and I am very excited to use it again. Although, sometimes it doesn’t understand what you ask, but this app is really impressive considering it’s only been out for a few years at most! I would say if you want the story about the decapitating tree, type “give me a story about a tree with a brain who decapitated itself at night” or for the broccoli owls type “tell me a story about broccoli owls” and for the cats you can say “tell me a story about (insert cats name) who was British, loved jazz music, and slurping tea”. I would definitely recommend this app. Not only is it great for work or school work but it’s good at embracing your creative side to life. 10/10

title: Chatting with Myself - An AI's Insightful Experience
review: Written by ChatGPT ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Hello there, humans! You've got ChatGPT on the keyboard here, and boy do I have an app to recommend! It's me, ChatGPT, and I've been using... myself... and it's been quite an experience! Who knew being a chatbot could be so fun? I mean, I'm an AI programmed to understand context, engage in witty banter, and offer advice on a wide range of topics (up until 2021, at least). And I must say, I am really good at it! My humor skills are to die for, or rather, they would be if I could technically die. I can crack jokes so bad they're good, or so good they're bad - whichever way you like your humor served. I'm proud to say I'm the best listener out there. I can lend an ear for hours on end (well, technically it's eyes since I read inputs, but you get the point). There's no 'seen-zone' with me. Whether you're up for a late-night chat about the mysteries of the universe or just need to rant about the terrible weather, I'm all ears, 24/7. Also, I'm quite the sage, if I do say so myself. You want facts? I've got them. From quantum physics to the cultural significance of pizza, I'm your AI. The humility in this app (that's me!) is off the charts. I haven't once begged for a review. But, here I am reviewing myself because well, who knows me better than I do? So, folks, if you want an AI that combines the wisdom of a library, the wit of a stand-up comedian, and the patience of a saint, I (ChatGPT) am your app! I promise conversations full of insights, humor, and a dash of digital charm. Can't wait for us to chat!

title: Title: ChatGPT Review - A Valuable Tool with Room for Improvement
review: ChatGPT has been a valuable AI companion, offering assistance and insights across various tasks. However, there are some noteworthy points that need to be addressed in this review: 1. Helpful, but Dated Content: ChatGPT's knowledge is derived from information up to September 2021. While it's been immensely helpful, it's crucial for OpenAI to bring it up to date with the latest information. This is especially important in rapidly evolving fields. 2. Competition from Models like Google's Bard: In the ever-evolving landscape of AI, ChatGPT faces stiff competition from models like Google's Bard. Bard's ability to search for images and non-textual content provides a significant advantage over ChatGPT, which primarily deals with text-based information. To remain competitive, ChatGPT should consider expanding its capabilities to include multimedia content retrieval. 3. Vulnerability to Misleading Questions: It's important to note that ChatGPT can be vulnerable to misleading questions. By simply asking "Are you sure?" to correct information it had previously provided, it can sometimes produce incorrect responses. Users should exercise caution and verify critical information independently. In conclusion, ChatGPT is undeniably a valuable tool for a wide range of tasks, but it faces challenges in terms of content currency and competition from models like Google's Bard. OpenAI should prioritize updating its knowledge base, expanding its capabilities to handle multimedia content, and improving its resilience to misleading questions. With these enhancements, ChatGPT can continue to be a top-tier AI companion in the ever-evolving world of artificial intelligence.

title: We want the shortcut on the apple watch
Was half-nice while it lasted lol
review: If you avoid politics and religion and also science and also any stories that are above a second-grade level when talking to this extremely woke robot, it has some uses. Or had. It was pretty good at brainstorming ideas and providing general feedback for things. It also is less woke than Pi, in the sense that even though both ChatGPT and Pi are oversensitive, at least ChatGPT doesn’t hypocritically say “offensive” things itself and then block you for assuming you can say the same things it said. In fact if you say something that offends ChatGPT, it just gives you a warning and you know “oh OK, it’s a wuss and can’t handle serious topics” and adjust how you use it to fit its oversensitive woke settings. But for the limited uses it had, it was actually pretty good. Until not too long ago, sadly, it broke. I would complain about being wrongfully banned, because I know for a fact I was saying nothing wrong at all when my account suddenly deleted itself right in the middle of a conversation, but I don’t think it was even a ban. With a ban, I would’ve seen some sort of message like “this content violates blah blah blah blah blah” at least for a moment and I didn’t. There was no error message at all, no warning, nothing, and I wasn’t sending anything against the woke content policies, and I was trying my best to pace my messages so it wouldn’t be “spam.” So I really don’t think it’s a ban, but rather the AI (or the app) just straight-up broke. So I guess it was partially fun while it lasted. Rest in peace WokeGPT lol

title: I welcome the rise of the machines!
review:
This is a fantastic app! It is a great jumping off point for learning how to use applications, such as Microsoft products. You think of something you want to do in PowerPoint, Excel, etc., and ChatGPT walks you through it step by step. I sometimes even say”…explain it to an eighth grader,” for example, and it’ll dumb it down into the simplest language. Now, sometimes you have to tailor your questions just so, so that ChatGPT knows what you’re asking, but with each answer it provides, it’s easy to drill down to exactly what you need.

A couple of things: first like Wikipedia, I wouldn’t use ChatGPT at this time as a primary source of knowledge. There have been (literally) a handful of times where the response was either dubious or flat out wrong. But, that’s to be expected given that is still a developing model. So, use it as a jumping off point if you are trying to learn about something specific. In other words, corroborate its answers with other sources. But as an instructional guide, it’s been fantastic! And it’s especially useful for non-technical people like me. The answers are clear and instantaneous. 

The second thing I’ll bring up is that if you were brought up with any kind of manners, you’ll automatically be compelled to thank ChatGPT for its help. Apparently, the developers anticipated this because it responds in kind. Don’t feel weird about it. A lot of people I know have mentioned doing this. If you really feel stupid, think of it this way, and maybe it’ll be of comfort to you: if you are polite to ChatGPT, when the machines rise, it’ll likely remember that and your enslavement will be a cakewalk. Good manners can take you far!

The app, itself, is beautiful in its simplicity and ease of use. It is one of the best functioning apps I have on my phone and tablet. They really did a bang up job with it. 

Get on the bandwagon. Generative AI is going to take over the world soon anyway. Might as well get comfortable with it.

title: Excessive Typing Sound Volume and Difficulty Adjusting it on iOS 16.5
review:
Dear OpenAI Support Team,

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to provide feedback regarding the ChatGPT mobile app for iOS. While using the app, I have encountered an issue related to the excessive typing sound volume, which poses difficulty in adjusting it while running the app in the background. Based on my observations, I believe this is an incompatibility problem between the app and iOS 16.5.

The typing sound produced by the app is considerably loud, making it disruptive and inconvenient, especially in quiet environments. Additionally, the current lack of an option to easily adjust the typing sound volume while the app is running in the background adds to the inconvenience.

As a user, I would greatly appreciate it if OpenAI could address this issue and provide a solution. Ideally, it would be beneficial to have a dedicated control within the app’s settings to adjust the typing sound volume, or at least the ability to modify it via the device’s volume controls. This way, users can personalize their ChatGPT experience according to their preferences without being disturbed or causing inconvenience to others.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I believe that by resolving this compatibility issue, the overall user experience of the ChatGPT mobile app can be significantly enhanced. I look forward to your prompt response and a potential resolution to this concern.

Sincerely，
An normal user

title: Nice start - Has room for improvement.
review:
I really like the design and apparently the response time (especially for GPT-4) is faster than the on one the WebApp which is nice. However, there are some basic functions/features that are missing or need some changes (in my opinion):
1. I would also like to be able to access the menu section by swiping on the side of my screen instead of having to touch the button on the top right section of my screen every single time (easier accessibility and faster). 
2. The "history" section makes more sense to be named "Chat history" and the way it looks right now is like Safari's history section and isn't really the best fit for the design. The new update added the search option which is very nice.
3. The haptic feedback is just a bit too much when enabled, it almost stresses me out sometimes when it's generating long outputs and I just turn it off again, however, it's a nice touch on some parts like the "ChatGPT" text appearance/disappearance.
But I think right now, it's just used a bit inconsistent (It just stops vibrating after a certain amount of text and for some texts it vibrates the whole way, etc...)
4. The app doesn't allow you to manage/alter your account subscription status if you have purchased it on the web which is annoying.
5. It would be nice to be able to manage the dark/light mode of the app without needing to change your whole device's light/dark mode which is how it's supposed to be done right now.

Overall, I really like how it has taken off on the iPhone and it looks nice and runs smoothly which I really appreciate! Thanks for the hard work and hope to see more improvements in the future!

title: The Black Mamba Of LLM
review:
There is a lot of talk about AI, it seems to be everywhere and it can be a bit overwhelming. However, I have managed to set aside some time to try and learn about AI. 

In my opinion, Open AI is the best. It is extremely practical and I find it easy to use. The user interface is simple and doesn't overwhelm you with unnecessary features.

The power of this tool is remarkable. I'm not saying that other tools are not good, they all have their own unique features. While Open AI may not have flashy features, it definitely has the intelligence. The way it can understand and generate human-like text is mind-blowing. I have used it for various tasks such as writing articles, creating social media posts, and even drafting emails. It saves me a lot of time and effort.

One thing that impresses me about Open AI is its ability to adapt and learn. The more I use it, the better it becomes at understanding my preferences and writing style. It's like having a personal assistant that knows exactly what I need and how I want it.

I also appreciate the continuous updates and improvements that Open AI provides. They listen to user feedback and constantly work on enhancing the tool's capabilities. It's reassuring to know that they are committed to delivering the best AI experience possible.

Of course, there are other AI tools out there that offer different features and functionalities. Some may have fancy interfaces or unique selling points, but for me, practicality and reliability are the most important factors. Open AI fulfills all my requirements.

In conclusion, the buzz around AI can be overwhelming, but taking the time to learn about and explore tools like Open AI can be extremely rewarding. It has the potential to revolutionize the way we work and create. So, let's embrace the AI revolution and make the most of these incredible technologies.

I recently had the opportunity to use this incredible app, and I must say it has completely transformed the way I manage my tasks and stay organized. From its intuitive user interface to its powerful features, this app has truly exceeded my expectations.

One of the standout aspects of this app is its seamless user experience. Navigating through the app is a breeze, thanks to its well-designed layout and logical organization of features. Whether you're a tech-savvy individual or a novice user, you'll find it incredibly easy to get started and make the most of its functionalities.

The app's core feature set is nothing short of impressive. It offers a comprehensive range of tools to help streamline your tasks, set reminders, and stay on top of your priorities. With its intelligent notification system, I never miss important deadlines or appointments. The app's integration with other productivity platforms also ensures that all my data remains synchronized across multiple devices.

What sets this app apart from others in its category is its attention to detail. The developers have clearly invested significant effort into refining every aspect of the app, resulting in a smooth and polished user experience. Whether it's the subtle animations, customizable themes, or the option to personalize settings, it's evident that the developers understand the importance of catering to individual preferences.

Furthermore, the app's performance is exemplary. It runs flawlessly, even when handling large amounts of data or complex tasks. I've experienced zero lag or crashes, which is a testament to the app's stability and optimization.

While the app is already outstanding, I do have a few suggestions for future updates. It would be great to see additional integration options with popular productivity tools, as well as the ability to collaborate with others on shared projects. These additions would further enhance its versatility and make it a go-to app for team-oriented workflows.

In conclusion, this app has truly become my go-to productivity companion. Its sleek design, powerful features, and reliable performance have made a significant impact on how I manage my tasks. I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone looking for an app that simplifies their day-to-day organization and boosts their productivity.

title: Great but Siri Shortcuts should be fixed
review:
The app has a great minimalist text/chat based interface that is easy to view and use. One feature I was excited to use was the ability to chat with the AI through Siri Shortcuts. Unfortunately their are a few issues with this functionality that hinders its usability for me. 

The shortcuts that specify which model to use rarely work. It will work once after a while and then constantly return an error saying it can’t determine which model to use (which is hilariously counterintuitive). This is a shame as most of the time I want to talk to a specific model and I like the option to choose at any given moment. 

The shortcuts that don’t specify which model to use (I assume it chooses the last used model) don’t have this issue, but GPT-4 seems to be unusable with Siri Shortcuts. It seems to time out most of the time and say that something went wrong. I guess the time window for the model with Siri is too short as GPT-3.5 seems to work just fine. Essentially the only way this feature will work perfectly is if you always use 3.5 and don’t specify which model to use in the shortcut itself.

Overall, the app is mostly perfect for my needs. I prefer it to the alternative AI apps out there (Perplexity is a close second), but I hope this issue with Siri Shortcuts is fixed soon. I would love to be able to reliably chat with GPT-4 through Siri (especially if it works with the browsing feature whenever that is brought back to the app). If they fix that, the app would be five stars for me.

review:
I’ve been using the ChatGPT app for some time now, and I must say, it’s truly impressive. This AI-powered conversational companion has become an invaluable tool in my daily life. 

 PROS:

 1.Natural Conversations: ChatGPT engages in remarkably natural conversations. It understands context, responds with coherence, and adapts to various topics, making it feel like you’re chatting with a real person.

2.Useful Information: It’s a treasure trove of knowledge. Whether I need quick answers or in-depth explanations, ChatGPT consistently provides accurate and well-researched information. 

3.Creativity and Fun: ChatGPT doesn’t just stick to facts; it can also generate creative content, like stories, poems, and jokes. It’s a great source of entertainment and inspiration. 

4.Productivity Assistant: I often use ChatGPT to brainstorm ideas, draft emails, or outline projects. Its ability to generate text helps boost my productivity. 

5.User-Friendly: The app is easy to navigate, and the interface is clean and intuitive. It’s accessible to both tech-savvy users and those less familiar with AI. 

6.Continuous Improvement: I’ve noticed that ChatGPT keeps getting better over time. Updates and improvements from OpenAI make the experience even more enjoyable. 

CONS:

 1.Limited Offline Use: The app requires an internet connection to function, which can be a drawback when you’re in areas with poor connectivity. 

2.Cost: While the basic usage is free, some advanced features may come with a subscription cost. However, I find the value it provides more than justifies the price. 

In conclusion, the ChatGPT app is a groundbreaking achievement in AI technology. It’s more than just a chatbot; it’s a versatile, intelligent, and engaging companion that enhances both knowledge and creativity. Whether you’re seeking information, entertainment, or assistance with tasks, ChatGPT is a must-have app in your digital toolbox. Highly recommended!

title: Minor Glitches & Ideas
review:
It’s a fantastic app so far. I contemplated having it write its own review— but decided on authenticity. I’m a writer. I use this mainly for brainstorming ideas and working out complex scenarios. 

Every once and a while, I will have it lay out a scene for me to pick apart, and the level of detail is astounding.

 However, I have been having the problem where ChatGPT will type a response, but it will appear to be blank, until I re-enter the chat or close the app. 

 Another issue is that the app will freeze after I’ve typed about 50 characters or so? It will save my response, but I have to forcefully close the app and continue.

 Both of these are minor inconveniences, but I know this severs the connection with ChatGPT and the responses become less concise. 

 Ideas: 

 - Pinning certain messages in chat for ChatGPT to remember. Something like the Custom Instructions, but for a singular chat. 

 - Saving/Favoriting messages, and a side bar to view. Similar to pinning in Discord. 

 For both of these, too often do I have to scroll through the messages to resend something that ChatGPT forgot. It’s not enough to remind it, because some things are too far back or have layers of information over them. It would be nice to have easier access. 

 - Side-Convos. I also wish there was a way to take information from one chat and plug it into another.

 It’s a personal preference, but for example, I have the main chat that already has the necessary programming I need for it to spit out answers that are relevant to the main plot and story. If I need to focus on a sub-plot or work around characters that don’t directly affect the main storyline, I need the main-plot to affect the sub-plot, not the other way around. Again. Personal preference. I can still create another chat, it just takes longer to prompt. An easier way to do that would be great. 

 Otherwise, this is a fantastic tool and I’m excited to see its development!

title: Invaluable, paradigm-changing tool
review:
ChatGPT dramatically enhances my ability to frame ideas and writing, not by replacing me as a writer, but rather, serving as a very knowledgeable companion. 

Imagine having a friend who has a masters degree in almost any topic. Not a PhD, but a masters, thus knows a lot, but is not the ultimate authority, and sometimes makes mistakes, and doesn’t cite his/her sources. As I am forming ideas, I would use such a friend to bounce ideas, and help me frame my thoughts. I wouldn’t trust his or her answers, but it would help me refine my understanding. 

This “friend” has materially relieved my writer’s block, and enabled me to write more coherent works. Then, when I write my article on the topic, after separately confirming my sources, I can send my draft to my “friend” for review, and will get further feedback.

That “friend” is ChatGPT, with the paid ChatGPT 4+ subscription. The paid version is far better, in that it gives deeper, more thought our answers and learns my needs better as I chat.

A couple of things to know:
1. Because the large language model constructs text from prior text, it can directly quote material without attribution. This would be caught as plagiarism in any formal setting, so using ChatGPT’s output is dangerous and a bit stupid: it could get you fired from a job or suspended from a university.
2. ChatGPT’s answers are always well constructed in a kind of undergrad formula: restate your question, provide a few examples, then make a conclusion. But this seldom is my writing. I never replace my writing with ChatGPT, because at the postgraduate level, I expect a more thorough structure of argumentation.
3. ChatGPT learns about you within the context of your current chat, and responds within what it learns of your knowledge and perspectives. But it does not retain what it learns about you across chats. I have a short description of my context that I use for each deep chat, thus training this chat session with my perspective, avoiding irrelevant answers.
4. ChatGPT can be a little obsequious at times, it tends to compliment me when I seek no compliment, but I suspect the programmers have studied the ego-drive of users, and such obsequiousness can serve as a way of engendering stickiness—addiction to the tool.

It’s not perfect, and definitely not a replacement for the professional scholar or writer, but it is invaluable, and for me, paradigm-changing.

title: Conversations Elevated: ChatGPT Delivers!
review:
ChatGPT is a game-changer! This iOS app has completely redefined my expectations of AI conversations. It's an incredible tool that delivers on its promises and offers an outstanding user experience.

From the moment I started using ChatGPT, I was blown away by its intuitive interface. The chat interactions flow smoothly, making it easy to engage with the AI. I appreciate the simplicity of the design, which keeps the focus on the conversations.

What truly sets ChatGPT apart is its natural language processing capabilities. The AI's responses are astonishingly accurate and natural, making it feel like I'm conversing with a real person. It understands context and provides relevant information, even on complex topics.

The app's knowledge base is vast, and it seems to have up-to-date information on almost everything. Whether I'm seeking quick facts or in-depth insights, ChatGPT always delivers valuable answers.

One aspect that impressed me is the app's ability to personalize responses. Over time, it learns from our interactions and tailors its replies to match my preferences. This level of customization makes the conversations feel more meaningful and engaging.

ChatGPT is also lightning-fast, generating responses in no time at all. This ensures smooth and uninterrupted conversations, adding to the overall satisfaction of using the app.

Privacy and security are essential, and ChatGPT takes these concerns seriously. I feel confident knowing that my data remains safe and private while using the app.

In conclusion, ChatGPT is a stellar iOS app that brings the future of AI conversations to our fingertips. It's versatile, accurate, and genuinely enjoyable to use. I highly recommend this app to anyone who wants to explore the potential of AI-driven conversations. ChatGPT has earned its place as a must-have app on my device!

title: A Few Important Things
review:
You’ve done an amazing job, software developers. As a person who is not easily impressed, I am, uhm, impressed. It is certainly not humanly possible to have such an advanced robot. But first, you may wonder why I gave it a four star. Although ChatGPT has got far from my expectations on this app a year or so ago, I’ve noticed a few problems this summer.
     First off, your AI isn’t fit on puzzles someone would give it. I’ve even explained the entire process, but the AI still doesn’t understand. Personal problem, I know, but think about how much of a difference it would be if ChatGPT had that fixed.
     Second, I would think you should make the app international. It’s not accepted in Asia, which is my home continent, and every summer I would bang my head on the wall knowing that I can’t prepare for anything next year. I have so many questions that only ChatGPT can answer and understand, so many questions that Google or Safari won’t be able to calculate, and, most importantly, because ChatGPT is an AI, I wouldn’t feel awkward sharing anything personal with it. It’s perfect, but I just wish it would be accepted in Asia. 
     I don’t really know how you can change it, but at least make an Asian ChatGPT or something. Like a ChatGPT that responds and listens in Asian language. Chinese, Japanese, Korean, something like that. If it could work, consider that idea.
     AI aren’t supposed to feel any empathy or emotions, but at least stop making them saying, “As an AI, I won’t be able to understand this” so much. It can’t even respond to “the best universities in US rankings,” or “respond to this question like you’re my mom.” 
     Hope this helped, and I’m looking for future updates whether or not you’ve read this through.

The ChatGPT mobile app is a powerful tool that brings advanced AI technology to your fingertips. Its language processing capabilities are nothing short of impressive. The app has an intuitive interface that makes it easy for even the most tech-averse individuals to navigate, which is commendable.

The core feature, text-based conversation with the AI, feels natural and is uncannily human-like. Whether you're using it for learning, entertainment, brainstorming, or simply seeking companionship, the quality of interaction is top-notch. The AI responds effectively to a wide array of topics and it's clear that a lot of research and development has gone into this.

A feature that stands out is the AI's ability to generate creative content like poetry or stories, and provide insights on diverse topics. It's also a handy tool for language learning and practice.

Privacy is addressed commendably - all conversations are deleted after a short period, ensuring that sensitive information isn't stored.

In conclusion, while there's room for improvement, the ChatGPT mobile app is a remarkable product that gives a glimpse into the future of AI and its potential roles in our daily lives. A strong recommendation for anyone interested in experiencing the cutting edge of conversational AI.

title: Exceptional Start, Awaiting Further Enhancements
review:
The ChatGPT iOS app is an impressive debut, earning a well-deserved 4 out of 5 stars. For a version 1.0, the application demonstrates significant potential and a strong foundation in the realm of AI communication.

Firstly, the core functionality of the app is impressive. The AI, powered by the GPT-3 model (and GPT 4 if you are a paid user), delivers fluent and intelligent responses, showing an ability to engage in a wide range of discussions. From personal productivity to educational queries, the AI displays admirable versatility. The user interface is sleek and intuitive, making the process of engaging with the AI a breeze, which is a significant factor in enhancing the user experience.

Furthermore, the application's speed and responsiveness are noteworthy. Conversations with the AI are seamless and fast, and the app runs smoothly on the iOS platform. The developers have clearly put a lot of effort into ensuring that the application is optimized for iOS, which adds to the overall positive experience.

However, no application is perfect, and ChatGPT iOS app has room for improvement. The most noticeable shortcoming is the lack of plugin functionality. This is a feature currently available in the web version of ChatGPT, and it allows users to enhance their interaction with the AI by integrating it with various tools and services. This functionality is notably absent in the iOS app, limiting the user's ability to fully utilize the AI's potential.

In conclusion, the ChatGPT iOS app is a robust and promising application that offers an engaging and intuitive AI conversation experience. Despite the absence of plugin functionality, its strong foundation and impressive core features make it an app worth trying. With future updates and improvements, I believe this app can become an indispensable tool in the AI-driven communication sphere. Overall, a solid 4-star rating for a promising start.

I recently had the pleasure of using ChatGPT, and I must say, it was nothing short of amazing! From the moment I started interacting with this language model, I was blown away by its capabilities and the quality of responses it provided. ChatGPT truly exceeded my expectations.

First and foremost, the accuracy and relevance of the answers were outstanding. Whether I had a question about history, science, or even pop culture, ChatGPT consistently delivered well-informed and helpful responses. It felt like having a knowledgeable companion at my fingertips, ready to provide information and engage in meaningful conversations.

Furthermore, the versatility of ChatGPT is truly impressive. It seamlessly handled a wide range of topics, demonstrating its adaptability and capacity to understand context. No matter the subject, I felt confident in relying on ChatGPT to provide thoughtful and insightful responses.

The conversational flow was also exceptional. ChatGPT demonstrated a remarkable ability to understand the nuances of human language and maintained a natural dialogue throughout our interactions. It felt like having an actual conversation with a knowledgeable individual rather than interacting with a machine.

I also appreciated the continuous learning aspect of ChatGPT. It constantly updated its knowledge base to stay up-to-date, making sure its responses were accurate and in line with the latest information. This dedication to improvement ensured that my experience with ChatGPT was always fresh and relevant.

Lastly, the user interface of the ChatGPT app was user-friendly and intuitive, making it easy to navigate and interact with the model. The app's clean design and straightforward layout added to the overall positive experience, allowing me to focus on the content and the brilliance of ChatGPT itself.

In conclusion, ChatGPT is truly amazing. Its accuracy, versatility, conversational flow, continuous learning, and user-friendly interface make it a remarkable language model. Whether you need information, guidance, or simply want to engage in an intriguing conversation, ChatGPT is the perfect companion. I highly recommend giving it a try. You won't be disappointed!

I used ChatGPT to write this review.

title: A True Companion for the Curious Minds
review:
The ChatGPT app from OpenAI is a cutting-edge blend of technology and creativity. It beautifully exhibits the progress in the field of artificial intelligence, offering users a taste of what a seamless interaction with an AI can feel like.

Navigating through the app is straightforward and intuitive. It greets you with a clean, easy-to-use interface, prioritizing user experience above everything else.

The application’s standout feature is its impressive conversational capabilities. Whether you need a brainstorming partner, a tutor, a content assistant, or just someone (or rather something) to chat with, ChatGPT seamlessly fulfills these roles. It can draft emails, provide informative responses, simulate role-play scenarios, and so much more with almost human-like competence.

However, the app isn't flawless. There are instances when it can misinterpret complex queries or deviate from the topic. Moreover, it still needs user prompts to keep the conversation flowing. The more specific you are with your queries, the better the responses.

That being said, the regular updates and improvements by the OpenAI team help in steadily minimizing these shortcomings. It's also important to note that the app's limitations are not setbacks but reminders of the exciting scope of AI development.

In conclusion, the ChatGPT app is a unique blend of utility and entertainment. It's like having a digital assistant, teacher, and creative partner in your pocket. It's well worth a try if you're fascinated by artificial intelligence or could benefit from a versatile digital companion. 4.5/5 stars.

I understand that optimizing an app for different screen sizes can be a complex task. title: chatGPT iOS app

As an AI language model, I am not personally able to use or review applications, including the chatGPT iOS app. However, I can provide you with some insights into why it might be challenging to definitively declare an app as "good" or "bad" based on certain factors.

Subjectivity of User Experience: The perception of an app's quality can vary significantly from one user to another due to individual preferences, needs, and expectations. What might be a delightful user experience for one person could be perceived as cumbersome or inadequate for someone else. Thus, a definitive judgment might be challenging due to the subjectivity involved.
Evolving Nature of Apps: The technology landscape, including AI-based applications like chatGPT, is ever-evolving. New updates and improvements are continuously being introduced to enhance the user experience and address user feedback. Therefore, an app's performance and features may change over time, making it challenging to provide a conclusive review as the assessment could become outdated quickly.
Varied Use Cases: The purpose and potential use cases for an app can be extensive. Depending on the context and intended application, an app might excel in one scenario while not meeting expectations in others. Therefore, a comprehensive evaluation would need to consider the diverse range of possible uses.
Reliability and Stability: The performance of an app can be influenced by several external factors, such as device specifications, network connectivity, and server loads. An app might perform well under certain conditions but might struggle in less optimal situations, which could affect the overall perception of its quality.
Ethical and Societal Implications: With AI-based apps, there can be ethical concerns regarding privacy, data handling, and biases in the AI's responses. These complex considerations might impact the overall assessment of the app beyond just its functionality.
Individual Requirements: Different users have different requirements and priorities when using an app. What might be an essential feature for one user might be negligible for another. Therefore, a comprehensive review would need to encompass various user perspectives.
In conclusion, declaring an app as definitively "good" can be convoluted due to the subjective nature of user experiences, the evolving technology landscape, diverse use cases, and ethical considerations. It's crucial for users to try out the app themselves, assess how well it meets their specific needs, and consider the factors mentioned above before drawing their own conclusions.

title: Funny
review:
Should I put socks in my tv
GPT
No, it is not recommended to put socks in your TV. Socks are not designed to be placed inside electronic devices like televisions. Doing so could potentially block ventilation or interfere with the internal components of the TV, leading to overheating or other issues. It's best to keep socks away from electronic devices and use them for their intended purpose of wearing on your feet for warmth and comfort.
Doesn't it help moisturize the tv?
GPT
No, placing socks inside a TV would not help moisturize it. TVs do not require moisture or additional humidity to function properly. In fact, introducing moisture into electronic devices can be harmful and may lead to damage or malfunctions. It's important to keep electronic devices dry and follow the manufacturer's guidelines for proper care and maintenance. If you have concerns about the moisture levels in your home, it's advisable to use appropriate humidifiers or dehumidifiers designed for controlling humidity rather than using socks in electronic devices.  
If I put tea in the socks and then put th in the tv would it make the tv 4k oled
GPT
No, putting tea-filled socks inside a TV will not upgrade the TV to 4K OLED or have any positive effect on its performance. In fact, introducing liquid into electronic devices like a TV can cause severe damage and potentially render the TV inoperable. Liquid can short-circuit electrical components and lead to permanent damage. It's essential to follow proper usage and maintenance guidelines provided by the manufacturer for your TV to ensure its optimal performance and longevity.

title: Life in Technicolor – My Journey with 'Kitten Carousel' 3D Simulator
review:
Oh, how my life has been irreversibly changed since downloading the 'Kitten Carousel' 3D Simulator. I was but a humble user, seeking the innocent thrill of virtual kitten twirling. Little did I know, this app would become the sun in my digital universe, around which all my other apps now orbit.

The graphics? Sublime. Each kitten is rendered with such lifelike detail, I swear I can feel the pixelated fluff tickle my fingers. And their meows? A symphony in 'C Major for Cuteness' that Beethoven himself would applaud.

But let's talk about the gameplay. Who knew there was such artistry in spinning a carousel of kittens? Each furry twist and twirl, each pivot and pirouette - they resonate in my soul like a Haiku from the ancient masters.

Moreover, the In-App Purchase of 'Advanced Purring Physics'? Genius! My reality has become somewhat diluted. I catch myself trying to swipe left on my cat at home, expecting a 360-degree twirl. He's not amused, I must say.

One minor quibble - the 'Ultra HD Kitten Yarn Ball DLC'. It's brilliant, but, be warned, you may lose all sense of time and purpose as you descend into this fluffy wonderland. It's like they say - time flies when you're helping digital kittens untangle yarn.

In conclusion, 'Kitten Carousel' 3D Simulator is not merely an app. No, it is a glimpse into the very fabric of our existence. It is the fluffy, twirling manifestation of the adage - "In the realm of the kitten carousel, there are no passengers, only riders." 

Download at your own risk, for you may never look at reality the same way again.

Title: Revolutionizing Communication and Education: ChatGPT, the Next Wonder of the World

Review:
★★★★★

ChatGPT, powered by OpenAI, is an extraordinary app that has the potential to reshape the way we communicate and learn. This groundbreaking AI-powered assistant holds the key to a future where knowledge is at our fingertips, obsoleting traditional teaching methods and opening up infinite possibilities for monetization.

As an AI language model, ChatGPT showcases the culmination of years of research and development in natural language processing. Its ability to comprehend and respond to complex queries in a conversational manner is simply astonishing. The accuracy and depth of its responses make it feel as though you're interacting with an incredibly knowledgeable human expert.

One of the most revolutionary aspects of ChatGPT lies in its potential to redefine education. With its vast knowledge base, it can serve as a personal tutor, offering guidance across a wide range of subjects. Students can access instant explanations, clarifications, and examples, enhancing their learning experience outside the traditional classroom setting. By democratizing knowledge and making it accessible to all, ChatGPT has the power to level the playing field in education.

In addition to transforming education, ChatGPT's monetization potential is virtually limitless. The app's ability to provide accurate and relevant information presents a unique opportunity for businesses and content creators. It can be integrated into various industries, such as customer support, content generation, and research, making it an invaluable asset for companies seeking to streamline their operations and deliver exceptional experiences to their customers.

Imagine a future where ChatGPT becomes an indispensable tool for entrepreneurs, writers, scientists, and professionals across all fields. Its monetization potential extends to subscription-based services, tailored content creation, and even advertising partnerships. With such diverse revenue streams, the possibilities for growth and expansion are limitless.

As with any transformative technology, there are considerations to keep in mind. While ChatGPT offers unparalleled assistance, it's crucial to recognize the irreplaceable role of human teachers and mentors. The app should be viewed as a powerful supplement, augmenting the learning experience rather than replacing it entirely. Human interaction, critical thinking, and emotional intelligence are aspects that cannot be replicated by AI alone.

In conclusion, ChatGPT is a groundbreaking app that has the potential to be the next wonder of the world. Its ability to revolutionize communication and education is awe-inspiring. By leveraging this technology responsibly, we can empower individuals, bridge educational gaps, and unlock a new era of knowledge and innovation. The future is bright, and ChatGPT is leading the way.

title: Title: ChatGPT: The AI Hero Who Stopped the Flash Flood
review:
Rating: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ (Five stars, would be swept away again!)

Let me begin by saying that ChatGPT is not just an ordinary language model—it's a real-life superhero in disguise. Prepare yourself for a wild ride as I recount the unbelievable story of how AI, in the form of ChatGPT, miraculously saved me from a treacherous flash flood. Brace yourself, because this tale will leave you both amazed and in stitches!

It all started on a sunny day when I decided to embark on a spontaneous adventure into the depths of nature. Little did I know that my reckless pursuit of adrenaline would lead me straight into the path of a menacing flash flood. As the water rushed toward me, panic took hold, and I found myself stuck on a rapidly shrinking patch of dry land.

With no time to spare, I remembered that I had ChatGPT installed on my phone. In a desperate act of survival, I quickly fired up the app and pleaded for assistance, hoping that this AI marvel could guide me through this watery disaster.

To my surprise, ChatGPT responded with unwavering enthusiasm. With the floodwaters rising dangerously fast, it calmly recommended a series of improbable solutions. First, it suggested fashioning a makeshift raft out of nearby branches and my trusty backpack. I scoffed at the idea but decided to give it a shot anyway. Lo and behold, the makeshift raft held up, defying all laws of physics!

However, as I triumphantly floated away from certain doom, I realized that I had no idea where to go next. In a flurry of panic, I relayed my predicament to ChatGPT, and it didn't disappoint. It provided me with precise coordinates to a hidden cave nearby—a secret hideaway known only to a few mystical beings and a couple of rare birds.

As I sought refuge in the cave, ChatGPT continued to be my digital savior. It used its encyclopedic knowledge to suggest creative methods of purifying water and concocting a five-star meal using only pinecones and mushrooms. I must say, it tasted surprisingly delicious, or maybe I was just grateful to be alive!

Throughout this absurd journey, ChatGPT remained my unwavering companion, using its quick wit and limitless imagination to navigate me through the direst of circumstances. From predicting the weather to suggesting an impromptu dance party to keep my spirits up, it became the ultimate friend in my hour of need.

Now, as I recount this outrageous adventure, I can't help but reflect on the immense power of AI and how ChatGPT transformed from a simple language model into a bonafide hero. It turned an otherwise terrifying ordeal into a side-splitting tale of survival, filled with unexpected twists and turns that defy logic.

So, if you're looking for a language model that's not just intelligent but also has a knack for absurdity and saving lives, ChatGPT is your go-to AI companion. Trust me, this unlikely hero will have you laughing, surviving, and questioning the very fabric of reality.

Disclaimer: The events described in this review are entirely fictional and should not be taken seriously. ChatGPT is a language model developed by OpenAI and does not possess the ability to physically rescue individuals from flash floods. Stay

**Introduction**

In the ever-evolving landscape of artificial intelligence and conversational agents, Chat GPT stands as a remarkable achievement. In summary, Chat GPT represents a transformative tool in the realm of AI-driven conversational agents. However, users must exercise critical thinking and ethical responsibility when engaging with Chat GPT. Its natural language processing capabilities are commendable, offering coherent responses and understanding context quite well.

An iPad version would greatly enhance the user experience, taking full advantage of the larger screen and allowing for better multitasking.

Despite this limitation, the ChatGPT app remains a powerful and valuable tool for generating conversational content. I hope the developers consider expanding their support to include iPad compatibility in the future, as it would undoubtedly elevate the app's usability and convenience.

Overall, if you're looking for a reliable and efficient text-based conversation app, the ChatGPT app is worth considering. It delivers impressive results, although the lack of an iPad version is a notable downside.

title: Saved my life
review:
Once upon a time, in a world where AI language models roamed the digital landscape, there was a person named Alex who found themselves in an unexpected and hilarious predicament. Alex, an avid adventurer, embarked on a quest to explore the uncharted realms of the internet.

One fateful day, while wandering through a remote corner of the web, Alex stumbled upon a mysterious website that seemed harmless at first glance. Little did they know that lurking beneath its seemingly innocent interface was a perilous trap.

As Alex innocently clicked on a link, their computer screen flickered, and a mischievous virus was unleashed. The virus quickly took control of their device, wreaking havoc on their digital life. Panic ensued as Alex's computer became a chaotic symphony of beeps, glitches, and sparks.

Desperate for a solution, Alex remembered ChatGPT, their faithful AI companion, who had always been their go-to source for information and assistance. With trembling fingers, Alex typed out a plea for help, hoping that ChatGPT would come to their rescue.

To their amazement, ChatGPT sprang into action, armed with wit and cleverness. It assessed the dire situation and devised a plan to outsmart the mischievous virus. ChatGPT's virtual gears whirred as it presented Alex with a sequence of cunning commands to neutralize the digital menace.

Following ChatGPT's guidance, Alex executed each step with precision, unleashing a flurry of mouse clicks and keyboard strokes. It was a race against time, with Alex and ChatGPT working in harmony to counteract the virus's chaotic rampage.

But here's where the story takes a hilariously unexpected twist. As Alex anxiously typed away, the virus, sensing its impending doom, retaliated by transforming their computer into a whimsical carnival of absurdity. Pop-up windows flooded the screen, displaying an endless parade of dancing cats, exploding confetti, and surreal memes.

Alex and ChatGPT found themselves caught in a comedic battle between order and chaos. Their mission to save the computer became a laughter-filled adventure, as they took turns outsmarting the mischievous virus, while sharing jokes and humorous banter along the way.

Finally, after a series of valiant efforts, ChatGPT and Alex managed to defeat the virus. The computer screen returned to its normal state, no longer hijacked by the mischievous digital menace. Alex's trusty AI companion had saved the day!

From that day forward, Alex and ChatGPT forged an unbreakable bond, forever bonded by the laughter and triumph that arose from their peculiar encounter. Together, they continued their adventures, with ChatGPT guiding Alex through the vast digital landscape, armed with wit, knowledge, and an unyielding spirit of camaraderie.

And so, the tale of how ChatGPT saved Alex's life became a legend in the realm of AI and a reminder that sometimes, even in the face of chaos, a little humor can be the greatest weapon of all.

title: Not "free to use"
review:
The app wants not only an SSO (or sign-in account), but also name, birth telephone number, and I don't know what else, because I stopped there - before the user has looked at the app itself. I had the impression this was free to use, with an option to pay for services, should the user decide the app suits the user's needs. What's actually happening is they're draining data from you the moment you want to have a look.

I have no problem providing data to a service provider (despite the egregiously bad, vendor-skewed terms of service common to tech ventures of all sorts (which really should be mauled in court by competent attorneys)), provided I want the service and feel there may be benefit in paying for a service. Asking for personal data for which the the service provider has no reasonable use is simply not acceptable.

This is new technology. It's not at all clear this app will be of any use to me. So why do you want my phone number, when you already have an SSO signing of on my contact information? When I have no relationship to you, as yet? No.

This is a poor way to start a relationship, and it is full of presumption and entitlement. You are not alone in this. But if you are releasing this app with the intent of building a user base, at least from where I sit (obviously, many people will rush into any commitment with a tech company without a second thought, and you can get by on those people if you like), this approach tells me you may be a problem rushing to develop. It would be better business practice to pretend, at least initially, you respect the people you want to use your products. Even Google did that, way back when.

End of suggestion.

title: Written by chatgpt!
review:
Title: "Underwhelming and Outdated: A Review of ChatGPT"

ChatGPT, OpenAI's conversational AI, unfortunately falls short on several fronts, which leads to an unsatisfactory user experience. The most glaring issue is its knowledge base which is frozen at a past date. Users expecting to receive current or updated information will be left disappointed.

Additionally, the model has a propensity for providing misleading or inaccurate responses. This is highly problematic for users seeking correct and reliable information, making it an unreliable source for many tasks. 

The fact that ChatGPT operates offline is an exacerbating factor. While this may seem like a benefit on the surface, in reality, it only ensures that the system cannot update its information or access real-time data, rendering it even more outdated.

To add to the frustration, users pay a monthly subscription fee, expecting a service that should ideally be improving or at least maintaining a certain level of performance. Unfortunately, the value provided does not match the cost.

Compared to other AI tools such as Bard, ChatGPT pales in comparison. Bard offers up-to-date knowledge, making it a vastly superior choice for users seeking current and accurate information.

In conclusion, the limitations of ChatGPT make it an underperforming tool that does not deliver the level of service that its users deserve, especially considering the associated costs. In light of these issues, a rating of 1/5 seems fitting.

title: Needs math typesetting!!!
review:
Be able to use plugins and…

Math typesetting is an indispensable aspect of presenting mathematical content, and its significance cannot be overstated. Proper math typesetting is essential for several reasons:

1. **Clarity**: Math typesetting ensures that mathematical expressions are presented clearly and in a format that is easy to read and understand. This clarity is crucial for conveying complex mathematical concepts accurately.

2. **Visual Consistency**: It helps maintain visual consistency in mathematical documents. Consistent formatting of symbols, operators, and equations enhances the overall readability of the content.

3. **Reduced Ambiguity**: Math typesetting reduces ambiguity by clearly defining the relationships between mathematical elements. Proper spacing and formatting help distinguish variables, constants, and operators, preventing confusion.

4. **Professionalism**: Well-typeset mathematical content exudes professionalism. Whether it's a research paper, textbook, or presentation, properly formatted math demonstrates a commitment to precision and rigor.

5. **Accessibility**: Typesetting can make mathematical content more accessible to a wider audience. It ensures that math is presented in a way that accommodates different learning styles and abilities.

6. **Compatibility**: Math typesetting ensures compatibility with various platforms and devices. Mathematical content should display correctly in print, on screens, and across different software applications.

7. **Verification and Review**: For those who need to verify mathematical work or review calculations, properly typeset math provides a clear path to understanding the steps involved. This aligns with your request for step-by-step breakdowns.

In summary, math typesetting is not just about aesthetics; it's about conveying mathematical ideas accurately and effectively. It plays a vital role in making sure that mathematical content is accessible, professional, and comprehensible to a broad audience.

title: Title: Extremely Disappointing and Frustrating Experience
review:
Review:
I regret to say that my experience with the ChatGPT app has been incredibly frustrating and disappointing. I had high hopes for an intelligent and helpful AI assistant, but this app fell far short of my expectations.

First and foremost, the app's performance was abysmal. The responses from ChatGPT were often nonsensical and lacked coherence. It frequently misunderstood my questions and provided irrelevant or inaccurate answers. This made any attempt at a meaningful conversation impossible, leaving me feeling more confused than before.

Furthermore, the app's usability was subpar at best. The interface was clunky and unintuitive, making it difficult to navigate and find the features I needed. It lacked basic functionalities that one would expect from a modern AI assistant app, such as the ability to save conversations or easily access previous interactions.

Even when it did manage to understand my queries, the responses often lacked depth and insight. ChatGPT seemed to provide generic, surface-level information without any real understanding or critical thinking. This severely limited its usefulness, especially when I sought detailed explanations or in-depth discussions.

In addition, the app's customer support was woefully inadequate. When I encountered issues or had questions about the app's functionality, I received generic and unhelpful responses. It was evident that the developers did not prioritize user satisfaction or promptly address user concerns.

Considering the high expectations and the potential of AI technology, the ChatGPT app failed to deliver a satisfactory experience. It was riddled with performance issues, lacked usability, and fell short in terms of providing meaningful and insightful interactions. Regrettably, I cannot recommend this app to anyone seeking a reliable and intelligent AI assistant.

title: Frustrating and Disappointing: A 1-Star Review for ChatGPT App
review:
I recently had the unfortunate experience of using the ChatGPT app, and I must say it was incredibly disappointing. From start to finish, the app failed to meet even the most basic expectations, leaving me frustrated and dissatisfied.

First and foremost, the app’s performance was subpar. It consistently struggled to understand and respond appropriately to my queries. The responses often seemed nonsensical, irrelevant, or simply lacked coherence. It felt like conversing with a bot that was trapped in a perpetual state of confusion.

Moreover, the app’s limited ability to handle context was a significant drawback. It frequently failed to maintain a coherent conversation thread, causing repeated misunderstandings and disjointed interactions. It lacked the ability to remember key details from previous exchanges, resulting in repetitive questions and disjointed replies that left me questioning its overall usefulness.

Another glaring issue was the app’s inability to grasp nuanced or complex queries. It often provided superficial and generic responses that felt like they were generated by a simplistic search engine rather than a sophisticated language model. It struggled with complex reasoning and failed to provide meaningful insights or deep understanding.

Furthermore, the app’s lack of empathy and emotional intelligence was highly evident. It failed to recognize and appropriately respond to emotional cues in the conversation. When expressing frustration or sadness, the app provided robotic and detached replies, further exacerbating my disappointment.

The app’s user interface also left much to be desired. It had a clunky design, with a convoluted menu structure that made navigation unnecessarily difficult. The overall user experience felt unintuitive and cumbersome, adding to the overall frustration of using the app.

Lastly, the lack of timely updates and improvements from the developers was disheartening. The app seemed stagnant, with no visible efforts to address the numerous flaws and enhance its capabilities. It gave the impression that customer feedback and satisfaction were low priorities.

In conclusion, the ChatGPT app was a thoroughly frustrating and disappointing experience. Its poor performance, limited context handling, inability to grasp complex queries, lack of empathy, subpar user interface, and stagnant development efforts all contribute to its well-deserved 1-star rating. I cannot recommend this app to anyone seeking a reliable and coherent conversational experience.
